title: I had one of the most horrible…
text: I had one of the most horrible experiences I have ever had at Rainbow this past Saturday 5/25/24. At time of check out there were 2 young ladies at the register and 1 line. There were 2 ladies being checked out but one was still actively shopping and the cashier continued to wait in them even with a long line forming. The other cashier was holding a non-work conversation with the customer and manager of the store in Spanish then engaging the 2nd cashier in conversation. Again there was a long line forming. After the ladies finish checking out the 1st cashier looked at me and walked away from the register. There was another customer that approached the 1st register and the cashier walked back up and waited on the customer instead of taking the next person (me) in line. I said excuse me I was next and the cashier advised that the customer was with the other group that had already left and the customer told her to wait on her pissing off me and the rest of the people in line. The manager and 2nd cashier stood by and watched the whole situation play out and all the manager said was she will be with me next. I mostly shop online but with this bac customer service I may stop shopping with Rainbow altogether.  Managers should lead by example and everybody employed at the Rainbows at 141 N Nellis Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89110 that worked there that day should be fired. Wish I could give no stars because that's what that store deserves. Also you may want them to clean the store as it was extremely filthy.

title: Consistent unprofessionalism and lack of integrity
text: Today I went to Rainbow of Maple Heights in search of a dress . I couldn’t truly enjoy my shopping experience and  I couldn’t figure out why . Not to mention he ( the manager Mr. James) didn’t acknowledge me or other customers while they were entering the store. Granted , he was training someone.. but wouldn’t you want to show exceptional customer service while you’re training a new employee??!I begun to shake and feel super uncomfortable. Finally I asked the manager short , bald black guy and alittle heavy set was he the manager about a year ago. He shared that he was . He was very nonchalant and completely unprofessional. I  shared with him distressing experience at this location that directly involved him and impacted me .  I feel compelled to share due to my experience today . ( I hadn’t been back in this location since the accident till today) While shopping, I unexpectedly passed out. My best friend asked the manager if we could use the restroom because I wasn’t well. He hastily shared “ that’s not my problem and we don’t have a restroom , NO” .  Then I passed out and hit my head on a shopping rounder . I later learned , today that he is the store manager and his name is Mr. James. My best friend and Sorors called the EMs, which is where I regained consciousness. From the information given to my support system from the EMs workers and the Police that was present with me at the store they said , the manager had absolutely no concern and no comment.  They were disappointed by his complete lack of respect and concern for his customers. Unfortunately, the manager's response was far from helpful then and today while I was sharing my concerns and my story. Instead of offering support or calling for medical assistance, the manager seemed indifferent to my situation. This lack of compassion and basic customer care was incredibly disappointing. In an emergency, one would expect the staff, especially the manager, to be trained and prepared to handle such situations with kindness and professionalism. Regrettably, that was not the case here. I urge the upper  management of Mr. James to reconsider their approach to customer safety and staff training to prevent such distressing incidents from happening to others. Today , as I politely reviewed my past experience with him he remained utterly un phased, completely nonchalant and rude as he shared “ Well your ok now … so what was I supposed to do ?? You had a people there helping you “ . Also when this incident occurred my brother Darin left a review that is also posted on this forum. This terrible experience and his lack of customer service and compassion helped me remember why I stopped going to this location. It swiftly reminded me why I drive to the shaker location. Although,  I was literally shaking and almost in tears while sharing my experience with him. He held tight to being completely unsympathetic and rude and exposed a continued a lack of empathy. I’m proud that I was able to speak to him politely and with confidence. Praying that this doesn’t happen to anyone else again. I hope that upper management recognizes the importance of safe, effective and responsible management. It’s clear that this location lacks all of the above or atleast Mr. James does. Unfortunately from reading reviews it shows that many customers still share unfavorable experiences with Mr. James.

title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE from the manager at the Hawthorne California Store and via Telephone for Online Orders!!
text: I went in to the Rainbowshops Store in Hawthorne California to return a blazer that was too small. I ordered it online and the receipt had the last 4 digits of a card as payment that is different from my actual credit card number. My credit card did work when swiped but the numbers are different from the ones on the receipt. The manager was very rude and basically said I didn’t know what card I used to pay for the purchase. She said this in front of other customers and she stopped taking care of my return to have a long conversation with another customer in Spanish. The lady had just been helped by another salesperson. I called customer service and the woman I spoke with said the same thing. I explained that I only had 2 cards and the one I used for the purchase I had in my hand and Rainbow charged. I didn’t know where the other numbers came from. The manager as well as the customer service person dismissed me as stupid saying it’s not their fault that I didn’t know what card I used. I was only allowed credit or a gift card. The manager said she never heard of this happening before and asked other salespeople if they had ever heard of this-in front of other customers. I did an exchange. I called customer service again after I left the store to find out what might have happened that the numbers were different and I asked for a supervisor. I spoke with Dee who informed me that sometimes when online orders are done credit card companies use different numbers for payment instead of the actual credit card number. I called my credit card company and that is what happened. They used a virtual card number to protect my privacy but that number is connected to my actual credit card. That’s why the card worked and the payment shows on my credit card statement. The manager at the Hawthorne Store as well as the customer service agent could have told me same thing. I will never shop at Rainbowshops again. Their Customer Service in store and online (the customer service agent I spoke with via telephone) is horrible.

title: Discriminatory and aggressive treatment
text: The cashier in charge at the time of the transaction, a heavy-set black man with a foreign accent, was dismissive at the time of the sale transaction, which my niece and I tried to handle in a friendly manner. Although from the moment we entered the store we were aggressively followed closely by a white female employee, who almost got between the racks and my niece, every time she was looking for items she liked, under the pretext of arranging the garments. Unfortunately my niece chose the Rainbow store at Franklin Square Plaza, in Bloomfield NJ, 07003, to make her winter clothing purchase, since she was interested in some items that were on the outside racks, when we were on our way to Marshalls. Unfortunately the store does not have dressing rooms, she could not try on, so she bought everything she wanted, to later return what did not fit. However, the return resulted in an aggressive attack from the same cashier with whom the purchase had been made, because he was asked to make the return in cash, he denied that the transaction was made in debit, even though it was paid with a Visa Debit card, he insisted that it was a Visa Credit card, although in the receipt says in Spanish Visa Debit. That is why I usually don't go into Rainbow stores, the clothes are poor quality, and the staff is always rude. Same cashier referred to us when my niece was paying as "these two", in a derogatory way, even though she was making a purchase of more than $100, to them, we still looked like thieves. I say that we got a discriminatory treatment, because I saw the cashier been polite to a young black woman who was making a transaction before us. He practically treated me as ignorant, arguing loudly and aggressively with arrogance that I didn't know the difference between Visa Credit and Debit.Not because I am Latina, certain age and speak some English, I don't know the difference, I make almost all my transactions with credit and debit cards like anybody else in this country. He stereopypes us and he chose to treat us with aggressive contempt.  He deserves a lawsuit. I asked him to print his name, he didn't want to do it, I told him that I was going to express my complaint about the terrible treatment that he had given us as well as again the employee who aggressively followed us through the entire store during this bad experience, I wanted my niece to return everything, but she wanted to keep the majority of the purchase. Because I don't like to give my money to someone who treat me badly. Although  he didn't give me his name, I found this information on the receipt:Rainbow10 Franklin Street, Bloomfield, NJ 07003Store# 01189Term# 002Trans# 408841Operator#1178JW

title: Stay away from Chagrin location Cleveland,OH
text: The Chagrin location in Cleveland Ohio was one of the worst experiences of my life. Two days prior I bought a cute dress for $9.99. When I got home I removed the tag and tried the dress on assuming it fit me, but it didn't fit at all. Remember the dressing rooms are still closed due to covid so you can't try anything on in store. Two days later I planned on doing a big summer haul at Rainbow at that point I would also return the $9.99 dress. The cashier was immediately combative in not wanting to except my refund due to the tag being removed, but I pointed out to her that I had the tag with me it was just simply removed. She still being combative and condescending did not want to issue the refund. She said we can ask the manager to who her surprise agreed with me that I am due a refund. She said the tag being removed is a simple fix that they can easily put the tag back on. More importantly was the fact that I had the receipt and the dress was purchased just two days prior so they should issue my refund. I believe this bruised the young woman's ego as she was expecting the Manager to agree with her. This woman had a very very condescending attitude towards me even when she was speaking to the Manager I tried to explain how I had the tag with me and the young girl raised her hand up as if to say "talk to the hand" because she too was speaking with the Manager. So already her tone was extremely arrogant and condescending toward me.  Next I began my huge haul that took almost two hours of shopping. From picking out clothes to standing in the mirror along with other women having to literally put clothes over are own clothes to see if they would fit, since the store has not reopened the changing rooms. As you can imagine this was extremely frustrating. So after two hours of this I was finally finished and ready to cash out. The only cashier available was the woman I had trouble with earlier. She began ringing up all the items which was extremely time consuming because I had roughly $500 worth of clothing. I had dresses, shorts, pants, jewelry etc.. that took up most of the counter space. As she began to ring up one blouse in particular she noticed it did not have a tag. She asked if I could pick out another one that might have the tag on it. To my surprise none of them had a tag and I took a few to her to show her. She then asked if I got these blouses off of a rack because if they weren't tagged they probably weren't supposed to have been put up yet. I told her they were on the rack. She then said well "If there is no tag I cannot sell it to you" I really wanted the blouse it was one of the few items in my haul that really stood out to me. So I said can we ask the Manager we spoke to earlier if she can find out what the price is because I really want this. She calls the Manager over and starts being difficult again exclaiming how she can't sell it to me. Then I asked if she wouldn't mind seeing what the price is. The Manager walked over and also didn't see a tag so she picked out another top on the same rack, similar style and told her to ring it up for that price. To which the confrontational casher replied " I don't want to do that" At this point I am now furious what do you mean YOU don't want to do that? Your superior gave you an instruction you have to do it. So I got mad and told the woman "Look you have been confrontational with me ever since I walked in here earlier to return the $9.99 dress. You are just looking for a reason to be combative towards me. So I tell you what since you don't want to ring me up, I don't want to spend the $500 I was planning on spending how about that. To which she replied "fine, cool" So I said you are going to let a blouse that is worth roughly $25 to stop the store from receiving $500 in revenue? She says "that's just fine" So to wrap this all up this woman allowed a $500 ticket to leave the store in the middle of a recession over a $25 blouse and her ego! Asinine and I want her fired!DO NOT  I repeat DO NOT EVER shop at this location.

title: I had the worst experience I have ever…
text: I had the worst experience I have ever had shopping at Rainbow on 26100 Greenfield Rd Oak Park Mi 48237.On 5/15 I brought a tshirt. First of all they don’t have any dressing rooms or mirrors in the store and when I tried on the Tshirt at home it didn’t fit correctly. I brought the tshirt back on 5/24 around 11am and the manager whose badge read miss b dumped the bag on the counter a tag to a different tshirt fell out and she instantly told me oh you can’t return this because the tag is not on the tshirt but she didn’t look at the tshirt to see if there was a tag. She had a really nasty attitude. When I got home I pulled the tshirt out of the bag and I saw the tag on the tshirt and I discovered a loose tag in the bag. So on 5/25 I took the bag back to the store and I also wanted to purchase other items. When I Was ready to check out I gave her the bag and told her of the mistake that was made.She instantly started yelling at me and accusing me of bringing in a different tshirt that did not match the receipt. I was trying to explain to her what happened and she started yelling and over talking me. So I asked her to just ring up my other items and she said I don’t have to ring up anything for you and you can get out of my store I don’t have to do anything for you. I asked her why and I said I’m a customer and you’re refusing to ring up my items she said yes but gave me no explanation of why. I asked the young lady next to her could she do it and the manager told her not to and she agreed. I then asked for the corpora number and she said you can google it so I did. I explained  to them what happened and they said they would call the store. After the corporate lady called the store and talked to the manager she let the other cashier ring up my items, but now there is an investigation for me returning my shirt. The shirt does not fit and I don’t want it. I’m not trying to be difficult but my receipt and tag matches so I am entitled to a refund. This took 30 minutes for me to resolve and it was completely ridiculous for someone who works in the store to refuse to let me purchase things from the store. She is not the owner what right does she have to do that. She was very rude with a horrible nasty attitude she has no business being a manager and she needs customer service training. I still want the refund corporate is supposed to be following up with me I am expecting a phone call but I would no longer shop at rainbow and I will make sure I let others know about my experience.

title: Placed a free standard shipping order…
text: Placed a free standard shipping order 3-7 day delivery, the package sat with FedEx for 7days. Called rainbow shop for them to trace the package they (rainbow shop) provided a tracking number for USPS. Tracked the package through USPS it stated they received electronically 12/21/22 from the shipper to send via USPS which is odd, I order from the rainbow at least once a month and this has never happened before. On 12/22/22 FedEx sent to usps which took even longer. Make a long story short it took 13 days for my package to be delivered, which is way over the rainbow shop standard delivery. FedEx had a delivery date listed for 12/22/22 once they received the instructions from the shipper (rainbow) to send via USPS they did just that. FedEx has a responsibility as well, they held the package for 7 days instead of delivering it. The package went all over town before I received it. I placed a premium delivery order 12/28/22. Once again FedEx displayed a delivery date 1/1/23 I considered a holiday no delivery for a Sunday. Checked today my package is in a different part of town from where it's normally delivered from. Smh I can already tell it's going to be the same thing outside of the delivery time 2-5 days. If the rainbow shop is going to us USPS start with them and end with them it's too much handing packages off to another party to deliver. The online selection is better than the store selection which keeps me ordering online. I will say once USPS received the package which was a Friday I received it that Tuesday. Quicker delivery than FedEx. Let's you know FedEx is not the best/quickest for a delivery service. The sad part is as lm doing this review it looks like the rainbow shop does not respond but they ask for a order number to identify you and reply to you. The delivery is a problem and needs to be addressed and fixed.

title: Ordering Mishap
text: I placed an order for some shirts. Then I got an email that my order was canceled by my request (I did not cancel my order). Then I got an email saying I would be refunded $0. So - my order is canceled and you're not refunding me? Unacceptable! I just wanted my shirts!

title: The rating deserves zero stars
text: The rating deserves zero stars, because the advertisement of my order was very deceptive. It deceived and tricked (me), the customer into thinking I was ordering the entire outfit, (the matching tops and the bottoms), by advertising the matching sets together. When my order finally arrived, it only had the tops, without the bottoms, which was extremely disappointing, and made me very angry. I would have never placed that order if I knew I was only ordering the tops of the advertised matching outfits, or the jogging suit jacket without the bottoms. This was my first time placing an online order with Rainbow Shops. I placed the order to have some outfits to wear for the holidays, just to end up receiving only the tops, to the advertised outfits. Tricking the customers with deceptive advertisement is never good for business. You just lost a very valuable customer who shops at the local Rainbow stores on a regular basis. I do not want this order with only the tops of the outfits without the matching bottoms. I will never ever place another order from the online Rainbow shops ever again. It's been an extremely horrible and super disappointing first time experience.Respectfully,Marolyn Levon

title: App charged me without confirmation, website would not allow me to cancel only 5 minutes after and customer service was awful about it
text: I was looking at a possible item to order and wanted to see how long it would take before I actually committed to ordering it and before I could even see shipping options it automatically logged into my Shopify account and charged me for the order without any sort of confirmation! I then followed the prompts in my order confirmation email to cancel to order online and was denied cancellation. The email states I had 15 minutes to cancel and I attempted to do so only 5 minutes after however it still would not allow me. I emailed your customer service explaining what happened and that I would like the ordered cancelled and a refund but they kept saying because I emailed them after business hours it wasn’t possible. I repeatedly explained the problem wasn’t with them the human beings being able to cancel the order but the website saying I was not allowed to cancel even though it had only been five minutes after the order was made. I included screenshots of the order and website denying me cancellation and they kept running circles around me ignoring what I was saying and repeating the same thing about my email being after business hours when I kept telling them that was not what I was referring too until they just started to completely ignore me all together. Your app and website is a mess and has major flaws and now I have a piece of clothing I don’t even need anymore and either have to keep it or find time to drive out of my way to a store and return it like they suggested and lose the money (I did not consent to spending) on shipping. I will never order from you again.

title: Wolf Creek Parkway Cordova TN
text: I walked into the store on Wolf Creek Parkway in Cordova Tennessee about an hour before they closed yesterday. I walked in went straight to a rack that had leggings at it. There was a big yellow sign above the entire rack of leggings saying that they were on sale. I grabbed two pairs and the total should have came to about $12 with the sale. I've been shopping at rainbow for 10 years now. It's the same little sale signs they've always had. I stood at the register for 7 minutes with an associate unpacking boxes seeing me stand at the register and refuse to acknowledge me or get a cashier to the register. There was three employees total in the store so I don't really feel like there was a reason that I should have been standing there that long. I get to the register and the leggings ring up for almost double what they were supposed to be according to the sale sign. I brought it to the attention of the lady that was working at the cash register. She informed me that I got something that was not on sale. So I said okay that's fine. I walked back to the rack picked out two more pairs. They did not ring up through the correct price. My daughter needed them for school the following day as a requirement. The cashier never tried to make it right. They didn't remove the sale sign. Because my daughter needed them. I had to go to my vehicle to get some more money. This was about 30 minutes before close at this point. The lady had an attitude because she had to let me out the door because she had already locked it and let me back in. The issue was never about the money for me. It's the fact that the clothing was clearly marked that it was on sale and no one tried to even remove the signs or make it right. And the lack of good customer service that I received at that store. I have went to rainbow stores all over Tennessee and Mississippi. I have never been treated that way. Nor have I ever had an issue with buying stuff at the price that it's advertised for. I understand the frustration of last minute customers. I have worked in restaurant management for 13 years. Tired, long day, ready to go home or not all customers deserve to be treated well.

title: Rainbow site is deceiving customers
text: Rainbow site is deceiving customers.  I kept buying several Mini Tank Dresses of different colors considering that are 95% Cotton as it is mentioned on item description. When I emailed them with the complain, I received a comment that mentioned they recorded and submitted the feed back, but there was no action taken.  I already washed all of them, and removed part of the tag that was uncomfortable. I am allergic to Polyester, and I do not know how to solve this matter.  I consider Rainbow very unprofessional, misinforming and deceiving customers.  They should be ashamed.

title: Worst experience ever!!!
text: Worst experience ever!!!! I arrived at Rainbows in Apopka FL at 6:49pm today. I had a return, as I’m walking to the line I see a pink dress it’s my size (sweet!) I grab it and continue to head to the line. There is a few people on the line, a couple, a lady who just got rung up, another lady waiting and two other ladies with two kids. I’m a patient person so no biggie. There are two cashiers (one is an assistant manager, who needs to go back to being an associate until she get more training, but back to the poor experience). The “assistant store manager” tells the other cashier to stop ringing up people and to lock the doors and turn off the lights. There are still people inside the store waiting online to be rung up, I understand locking the door but turning off the lights while there is still customers in the store I’m not sure on the but ok. So she finally gets to me, I place my return and pink dress on the counter she looks at the return and says “I can’t take this you need to leave my store my register is closed” I’m in shock, like excuse me come again!!! “She goes you should have been on line before 7” I say what you mean I been on the line this whole time!? She goes “well I can’t take this my register won’t ring up anything after 7 you should have came an hour earlier” I say”it shuts down?!  What ?!” She goes “ that is our store policy and if you don’t leave I will call the police” mind you she is taking the tills out the register and begins counting down the money. I call customer service she calls the police. I explain the situation to customer service she verify  the system automatically shuts down at the stores closing hour. That makes no sense because what if they are not finished checking people out! Then on top of that today was the last day to return or I would have gotten a store credit which I didn’t want. I leave the store the police outside I explain the situation to them and then I leave. I will never ever shop at this location again!

title: NOT WORTH IT STORE
text: This company has offered a robotic response. I mailed items back on the 13th of June and Rainbow Shops received those items on 5th of July. I had a FedEx agent verify this twice. The Fedex Agent even called Rainbow Shops and the store said they had received the items and were issuing a refund I called today 3 times and each rep told a lie. They said the manager had to redo the refund because it did not go through the first time. I called back shortly and was told the manager was reviewing notes. I told them to just refund the money because they had the items. I told them this was too easy and they are doing nothing but ripping customers off. They give the runaround to keep peoples money. Thieves and thieves they are. There is nothing to look over. Do not shop at this store. If you have a return, they try to keep your money through a store credit. I ordered online through Klarna and took 3 items back to a physical store in Savannah, Ga for a refund. They are not set up to refund it back to Klarna, so I was issued a store credit. Later, I was informed that I had to return the items back through mail to credit my account. So, I went back to the store to request a refund or either the items and the clerk said I couldn't have either and needed to talk to her stupid manager in Jacksonville by waiting 5 more days and returning to the store. I told her that was unreasonable and to get the manager on the phone because this is called theft of them keeping customers money. This stupid clerk called mall security into the store to escort me out and then she tried to lie about the whole situation.  I told mall security this store had my money and I requested it or the items back and they could not keep my money.  I told this ragedy a&**( clerk I would call the police on her because this is called "theft" of what they are doing. In addition, I would also file a lawsuit calling mall security when they are the f%^& ones who had my money; stupid cow. However, I ended up finding 2 of the items I brought there for return and took them with me. It was an easy fix from the beginning and the clerk wanted to cause a big show. We will see who the big show will be on. I have never seen such stupidity and the great length this store would go to in order to steal money from customers; you can't take people's money. This is not over yet as they still owe me money.

title: Worst Experience with In-Store Return EVER!!! Manager Needs to Learn & Adhere to Correct Return Policy Rather than Argue with Customers!
text: I'm disabled so getting out for me isn't always easy that's why I do 100% of my shopping online several times per week. Upon attempting to return online purchases at a Rainbow shop location the manager insisted that their store had a 7-day return policy should customer want cash payment and that my only option was in-store credit.  I told her that wasn't true, that it's a 30-day return policy and that I don't want cash but for my credit card to be refunded.  She refused, I left and the following day I called customer service.  Customer Service stated that the manager was incorrect and that she herself hates when the store employees give out wrong information and she apologized to me for the clerk/manager's actions.  Customer Service then instructed me to return to the store, explain the return policy to the manager and show the manager the back of my order slips that detailed their policy; also the representative instructed me to call Customer Service department back while in store should the manager continue to refuse to accept return under the correct policy.  So, I returned a couple of days later and instructed my son to record the interaction because I felt that the manager was going to give me a hard time and I knew that if I was being recorded as well that I would control responding negatively according to the manager's disrespectful attitude and behavior.  Needless to say, the same manager gave me the same response, I told her she was incorrect and showed her the return policy on the back of my order form and she still insisted that she was right, that she's been telling customers about the return policy there for a long time and that even on the back of their receipts printed out after purchases that the return policy states "7-days".  I said to her that just because the receipts states that, that doesn't mean it's correct information and that I'm going to call customer service so that she can hear/speak with them and she replied, "Go ahead but it's not going to make a difference or change anything."I called customer service and as I explained the situation the manager leaves the counter as if she didn't want to hear what the representative had to say about the return policy.  The manager then reacts to my son recording the incident by saying: Oh, he's recording me!  He's recording me!  Who does that!I replied, "Who gives out incorrect information?"  She then tells my son to stop recording and we refused so she instructed another employee to call security on my son.  By this time several more employees surround the checkout counter, a few of which kept interjecting while the customer service rep on my speaker phone gave the store policy.  The manager continues to respond negatively to my son and he respond back to her that he wasn't doing anything wrong nor being disrespectful and that she was acting a little bit extra.  She then was told by another employee to go to the back and calm down.  Another older employee asked my son to walk away with them and I instructed my son to stay by my side.Another older employee whom stood by the counter beside me the entire time thought it was necessary to chastise our 20yr old son by telling him that he shouldn't have been disrespectful to the manager because she has sons too and that Black young men are getting into trouble , etc.  I ask how was he being disrespectful because he didn't curse nor call her names?  The lady contined to talk, not answering my question so I asked twice exactly what did he say that was disrespectful?   She never responded even when our son asked her the same question; instead she continued to chastise him.They still refused to acknowledge the customer service rep nor the policy on the back of my order form, telling me to come back a THIRD TIME when the District Manager would be available!  I refused whilst the customer service rep continued to explain over and over Rainbow's return policy.  Finally an employee called the District Manager, placed her on the speaker phone and the District Manager reiterated THREE times EXACTLY what the customer service rep and I both explained to them several times. Needless to say, another manager came from another store at the shopping complex and refunded my card accordingly.  There was this employee named Ashley whom were courteous to me the entire time we were there (about 20-25min).  Ashley apologized several times while the manager that was rude NEVER apologized nor acknowledged she was wrong about the return policy.  She was more concerned about the video being placed on social media and about being right rather than providing exceptional customer service.I've never experienced anything like this whenever I've made business or consumer transactions.  This was an awful, unprofessional, unforgettable experience in which I hope to never experience again.

How is it that they determine where an customer refund goes if it, reads back to original method of payment with an debit/credit that is linked?How you determine to give a customer store credit, first, it was error on their end sending two wrong items left me with 4 bottoms and no tops.Now lets make sense of it; when your making return within timeframe and conditions your coming in requesting for an refund and your excepting just that.Now the moment of hearing store credit your going to review your options to determine to agree with return in store or return it back via mail. I didn't get those options it was not giving to me store made discretion ; they processed my return told me would go back to original method payment been few days no refund in acct received as of yet thinking and trying to remember the company return policy checked it and for the method of payment dinged donged in my head store credit was issued and that is exactly what the store issued without my awareness of their online return policy no in store acknowledgement its not for customer to be in an situation remembering company's police as they have staff who is aware of it should always be implented to online returning customers especially when customers are within 30 days with receipt which is contract to refund vs without receipt issue store credit. This is a crisis.First attempted called customer service no assistance giving to fix refund issue then went back to the store was told all items already sold didn't believe that one moment and said; she told me it would be an store credit blah blah (not at all she said; that now its my word against hers and no way customer service should be that way in an federal trade).How people just take advantage of paying customers hard earned money and try to implent these return policy which I was in timeframe with and just forget about laws as well as if consumers has no right.Now under FTC which an refund should of been issued instead they illegally issued instead, an store credit in replace of it that could be looked at as FRAUD because this was not verbally agreed upon on return vs online return policy items were not purchased in store I had receipt I was giving in store purchase return without an receipt and that was not the proper cause.  Instead issuing an store credit instead of refund also, seems like money laundering as it didnt go back to it original method of payment; other options should of been weighed in to correctly getting me my refund back because that was my expectation under terms and coindtions.This is an taken of advantgae return policy tactic of refunding people reasoning got Fashion Nova with an court settlement with FTC.All I want is my $142.02 refunded not store credit not an option under any terms accepted without condition; even though policy reads it. I was not giving the option to decline verbally speaking with customer service over the phone nor at store in person.Poor customer service.I am an mother of two therefore, I know you know we know store credit is and would not have be an option to agree upon we would of sacrificed making that return via mail honestly.For brand use only: $sosom3Please refund to my cash app which is an payment method of an linked debit/credit card to my PayPal acct since your refusing to work with me issuing it back to orignial method of payment.Thank you

text: Please do not shop at Rainbow. Their customer service is horrible. I went to a local store and the clerk nor the manager knew the policy for returning an online purchase to the store. I even read the policy to them and they insisted that they were correct. Talking about returning something within 7 days no refund. Yes that may be true if I made a purchase at the store. I was given a store credit when I should have received my money. My loss but I will not be shopping with them again. I will give that store credit away to someone that enjoys their cheap quality clothes. I am not a frequent shopper there. I just saw some sneakers that caught my eye that I wanted to wear for my birthday party but they didn't work out so I had to return them.

title: Rainbow permanently closed fitting rooms
text: Rainbow clothing store, is permanently closing their fitting rooms. They closed They’re fitting rooms during Covid…they must have thought, that trying close on inside of their fitting room, contaminates them MORE. Instead…they want people to purchase them, put them In their car, taking them inside their house, try them on and then bring them back to the store lol what a joke. Do they wash them, when we bring them back? Lol no, they don’t…Now For some reason (hopefully it’s not because of Covid lol) they are permanently closing their fitting rooms.Almost Everything inside of the store is tight, and form fitting. Myself and others, including the employees of the store, understand that Women have to try on clothes like this before purchasing. From a business standpoint, This will only cause them to lose sales. I saw 4 people put their clothes back and leave because of this. I also heard one person say, “ they might as well close completely and only sell online, what an inconvenience.” I will no longer shop at Rainbow stores if they decide to close the fitting rooms permanently.

title: First ever online order
text: I placed my first order with Rainbow. The order was delivered several days later than the original ETA. My second order was three days later, although I paid $26 for one day shipping. I didn’t know one day shipping didn’t include the weekend until after my order was placed. That info should come up in big, bold letters so customers can have a chance to change their minds if the order will come after they need it. I called customer service and the agent said it’s true that Rainbow does not have the wording on the ordering page. She said you have to specifically go look for it. It’s not fair. I’m disappointed. I would have just waited a few days and not paid the exorbitant shipping fee that didn’t serve me. For my first online order, no compensation or offer of future discount. That would have been nice. But since I’m done with Rainbow I would not use it anyway. Also, regular orders include Saturday, but not if you pay for one day shipping. It makes zero sense.

I truly think you all (Rainbow Shops) should look to reevaluate/update your return policy in the near future.

title: Bad customer service. I will never order from your website again.
text: Bad customer service. I will never order from your website again.My shipping company change their location, unfortunately I typed in the old address and order the stuff. 20 minutes later I realized the mistake I made, so I log back on my account to try to change the address, which I was not allowed to do. I then decided that maybe I could cancel the order and reorder the stuff, also not allowed. As it turns out, unlike other sites that allows you 24 hours to cancel, rainbow only gives you 15 minutes, which I find is highly ridiculous. Call them early the next day only to interact with a very rude and unmannerly customer service representative, she basically told me the stuff had not yet been shipped but the label had already been printed, so that was the end of the matter. I asked her if they have not yet been shipped why can't they just reprint another label with the correct information as I really needed the stuff, she basically told me whether I got the stuff or not is my problem to deal with and not the company. In this modern age what company does this. When you order from other companies you basically have hours to cancel your order if you need to. If you make this kind of mistake you can message or call them and they will correct it. Not Rainbow. The way you treat your customers says a lot about the kind of business you have. Never me and your company again.

I am not making this up. It's absolutely ridiculous the length this lady went to for me not to get a medium size bag to fix my broken bag. So I told her I was willing to pay for a bag but she wanted to see me suffer and said no. People like this are very cruel. She was making a scene in the store over a plastic bag!! How embarrassing, customers were looking at her like she's  crazy!!! I made a purchase and all I ask was for a bigger bag instead of the small one but because this is a spiteful lady she told me no I don't care if your bag breaks. Very harsh and awful manager she needs to be fired please. Regional managers please fire this lady. I am traumatized because I told her ok I'll buy a shoe just for her to give me one plastic bag. I was at the counter about to purchase but she told the sales girl not to ring me up!! I asked the sales girl for her managers name but the manager told her not to give me her name. The girl looked scared to tell me her manager name! And then she called mall security on me. This is my story and true she will tell her employees not to say anything because she will probably fire them and they are scared of her. I am very traumatized over this situation as I am a regular customer and to be treated like a animal. Is uncalled for. I am reporting her and the store to BBB.Manager on duty at the queens center location Tuesday January 5th at 4pm.Please you don't need racist and horrible disrespectful managers at your store.Corporate please fire this lady at queens center mall.

title: I almost had to physically fight the cashier
text: I went to the storeat Mt Ephraim Ave Plaza 2869 MT. Ephraim Ave Camden NJ 08104 location today to do a little shopping for Christmas. When I entered the store none of the employees greeted me or any of the customers that came in after me. It didn't really bother me much because this is the norm for almost all of the Rainbow stores I shop at. I was done picking out the items that wanted and I proceeded to go to the register to check out. There was one guest in front of me and two employees behind the counter. One of the employees was working the floor when I entered the store. When it was my turn to ring out, cashier operator number 0685AH started to ring up my items. She never greeted me, she seemed irritated about something. I let her know that I has took clothing off of one of the forms hanging on one of the rounders because it was the size I needed. She "yeah OK." she kept ringing my item I asked her if a pair of the pants I was purchasing was a large as she was folding them and again she answered me very rudely, as if I was getting on her nerves for asking her questions. I had to ask her one last question, on which button is for credit too or bottom. She answered rudely again. I purchased a piece of jewelry and 3 outfits. She bagged all of my clothing and was going to enter my jewelry into the same bag and I told her can you give that me I will just put it in my purse because I didn't want it the clothing bag. She handed it to me, placed my receipt in the bag, and handed me my bag. I took my bag and proceeded to turn around and leave and she said "Girl what is wrong with you? " I said excuse me shocked because I didn't know who she was talking too, but I was the only one at the register. I said "who are you talking to?" she says, "I'm talking to you, why you snatch your bag out of my hand? " I said WHAT!?! "I didn't snatch my bag out of your hand." She started yelling yes you did snatch it out of my hand so her and I is now yelling back and forth cussing and using profanity at each other. The whole time the manager and other employees are standing by watching her behave like a crazy person. The cleaning guys was the only one that ask me to please step out if the store because he seen how it kept escalating. We were literally about to fight each other over her thinking I snatched my bag out of her hand.Here's my problem. I am not sure what kind of training is being given to the employees of Rainbow Corporations, but rudeness, disrespect, talking on cell phones while assisting customers, having side bar conversations while ring up customers, not focusing on the customers, and a ton of ghetto horrible behavior being displayed by employees is a reaccuring issue. I have never had to write a complaint or an email because none of those situations had anything to do with me. This incident put the nail in the coffin. I spend a lot of money with this company and to be treated like my business means nothing at all because of the employees that are being staffed at the Rainbow facilities is extremely crazy. I will be going to a different Rainbow to return everything that I purchased. I will be pacing this on my YouTube Channel, and all of my social media outlets as Well as leave a review on your company page. I am extremely upset and this situation could have went a whole lot worse involving police officers, jail time, and court appearance. I really suggest you guys get some secret shoppers to watch the activity of your managers and employees.

This manger said if you are going to shop you take your bag to the counter she hurt my granddaughter feelings, she made her feel like she was going to steal, that stuff is to cheap to steal! she is not a professional and should not be working in a department store for young people!!!!!! this manger should not be in this store that caters to young people, everyone does not steal!! and my granddaughter was with me her grandmother! there might be some situations you need to have a teenager by something in her store and then leave the bag at the counter, but this was not one of them. we did not come in the store with a bag, my granddaughter bought her Items there at Rainbow. We will never shop there again!!!!

title: 3 items returned. 4th fell apart during 1st wash
text: Updated again: the 1 top I kept didn't make it thru a single wash on delicate. I washed it to get the starch out before it's first wear. There are holes everywhere along the seems. Basically the entire order was a waste and I threw $12 in the garbage with the only shirt i kept that fell apart. Lesson learned. Don't buy from Rainbow ShopsUpdated: out of 4 tops (3 sweaters and 1 long sleeve off the shoulder t material), 3 were returned. Weird fit. Cheaply made. Horrible fabric. Looked almost nothing like the pictures. Definitely not true to size. Ironically enough, I ordered 3 sweaters for a vacation and found 1 long sleeve black top that was only $4 on super clearance and I rolled the dice on at the last minute and added it to my cart figuring if I lost the $4, its NBD. That cheap top is the only thing that fit as it should and was good quality. So because they charged me $6.95 for shipping to return the other 3 sweaters, I basically paid close to $12 to keep the one cheap shirt. I'm still ok with that as it fits perfect, is super soft but it can't be worn in the cold weather where I am. All in all, I gave rainbow a shot but will not order from them again.Still waiting for my items to arrive so I can only review the selection in my size. Which was pretty good. Hopefully the items I picked are true to size and decent quality. Will adjust my rating if they aren't.

title: I will never spend a dime at any of their stores again.
text: My information is correct. I always take snapshots of my screens when I make an order online with a company for the first time. I receive an order confirmation and then a cancellation. I called customer service and the first representative hung up on me. I called a second time and the representative could not explain the reason other than the verification dept could not verify my information. She could not tell me what information was incorrect as I told her all of my info was correct and the method of payment was reflecting a hold in my bank. I will never order or go to any Rainbow Shop again.

title: Poor Shipping and Customer service
text: I've purchased some items from this store to have them not shipped to me. This is the second time this issue has happened to me. Apparently the shipping company they use steals items before their shipped to recipients. I called FedEx to handle the issue they said that they can't help me. So I called Rainbow and they said that they can't help me either. I was told by Rainbow to file a police report. Which I  did so for that purchase. Now I'm out of money that Rainbow has taken from me. Poor customer service 😢

title: I went to this store for the first time…Very very disappointed. And hope that wasn’t the manger who yelled across the store with that very loud mouth.
text: I went to this store for the first time Thursday. Wow. Never heard someone yell so loud in my life. I was there with my niece she is getting married. And we had been shopping at other high end stores. But she wanted something from there. And this huge lady. Said and yelled across the store. Put your mask on or leave. I was in shock. I have a doctors note. That I carry with me saying I can’t wear a mask. Which is not her business. But. She was so rude and loud and others turned around and said oh well. She must own the store. Like I said never been in there before. So I told my niece. You shop and I will be outside   . She was looking for shoes. I said I will call Macy’s. But you shop. Guess with a rainbow name. Guess you get what you want. I love my rainbow sandals. But think this is just a different store. I have not told anyone how I was yelled at. So please contact me I need to let people know how this store is. And how you handle your employees. And please make sure they know the law and what they can say to someone. So please contact me. Thank you
